website_summaries.verdict: A basic slicer with few accessories and the need for extra stabilization during use.
pros: Japanese stainless steel blades and a professional-looking design
cons: Not as stable as some other slicers

customer_reviews.title: sales description is lacking full info on what comes with product
customer_reviews.text: disliked the product as it did not come with additional blades how can i send back and replace?
customer_reviews.author: The Gourmet Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with excellent results. Quite safe as well, especially if you buy the no cut gloves. Sliced a whole ginger root very thinly, in no time. Works great for julienne as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mihail A. Popa

customer_reviews.title: Harder to clean than old one
customer_reviews.text: I like the old one better...i want it to be easy to clean. This one has more hidden spots to clean. It works great its sharp and came on time
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wagnon

customer_reviews.title: A well built but small mandoline
customer_reviews.text: Using this tool requires skill, practice, strength, and more than a little courage. FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS. It will slice off a finger if you're not careful. Be careful, but not timid. I find the julienne blades useless for everything but turnips and the like, it clogs and mangles onions. Stick to the straight blade. Makes wonderful thin slices. It would be better if it were an inch or so wider to accommodate larger onions. Using this does create more waste (about 1/2 an inch of whatever slicing is mangled by the pusher/slicing guard. NEVER cut without it. Even so, it's fast and easy once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Frontier

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer! Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: We use this thing in a professional kitchen and it holds up to plenty of punishment. The blade is replaceable and is a straight edge so it's very easy to sharpen. With minimal care this thing will last decades. The julienne blades may wear out quicker if they're used heavily and there's no compartment that holds them with the slicer but that's a small complaint for all the benefits of this device
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Wow, great cut
customer_reviews.text: My first cut was with sweet pickles. Cut into long slices and they were so beautiful. I can tell from the sharp blade and the way the depth adjusts so precisely and strongly that this was a winning purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron See

customer_reviews.title: Amazing home mandolin sharp and strong
customer_reviews.text: Amazing mandoline, I had a Similar version in green but the knobs were plastic and the veg holder wasn’t too great. I saw this and purchased it and so happy I did. The blade is super sharp the knobs to adjust the blade are sturdy from metal or stainless steel and most important the Veggie holder is great and protects your fingers and has a strong grip. I use this for salads and makes everything taste much better when cut thin. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Not the same width as I have, returned
customer_reviews.text: I have a benriner, however it doesn't have the various blades, and mine has 2 turn screws to adjust the blade. Thinking I'd like to update after a lot of years, I bought this. Benriner's have different colors for different sizes, this is the color of mine. Upon arrival, this isn't the width of mine, and mine isn't the extra wide (different color anyway), or however it's listed. This is too narrow, in my opinion, to be able to slice potatoes or apples very easily. I returned it with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: iluv2garden

customer_reviews.title: Slotted blades pose a risk
customer_reviews.text: I use to work in a commercial kitchen so I have a good amount of experience with mandolins. There are three slotted blades only one of which creates a usable size. The smallest one is more of a shredder and the largest one makes the pieces so big it’d be just as easy to do it with a knife. The straight blade is fine but be very careful if you’re cutting anything that’s harder than a cucumber as the slotted blades don’t work very well and it takes a lot of force to get something like a carrot cut.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason why this is standard issue in commercial kitchens. It just...works. It doesn't try to include a bunch of bells and whistle and doesn't come with a bunch of random gadgets that don't work. It's just the mandolin itself with its super sharp blade, then a few more interchangeable blades. No fuss. And if you clean it promptly after each use before food dries on it) a quick rinse and run with a sponge will do the trick. Get yourself some protective gloves though. Your fingertips will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: ChenP

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, wide body great for cabbage.
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp, easy to use works great, easy to clean and very precise cuts. If you are looking for the best mandoline on the market look no further. i was able to cut soft tomatoes, hard sweet potatoes, and super thin cut my cabbage for sauerkraut. I purchased the Jumbo model and intend to also get the thinner super model.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Shiver

customer_reviews.title: After 4 other tries, found the perfect mandoliine
customer_reviews.text: So interesting to read the other reviews. I can't imagine how someone had a problem using this mandoline. For about 10 years, I've been wanting a mandoline, and I have to admit I was a bit scared to use one when the online shops also advertise a protective glove. I've tried several other brands of mandoline, and they were just to complicated + didn't do the job. This one was perfect, easy and felt safe. I easily adjusted the thickness for beautiful slices of potatoes, zucchini and onion. Packaged great, comes with 3 other blades. Very happy with this mandoline. The hand guard works great too.
customer_reviews.author: 21march

customer_reviews.title: WIDE!  I have another but this is both ONION width plus and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: WIDE! I have another but this is both ONION width plus and easy to clean I have one that has lots of blades and is tediously challenging to clean up - THIS is just so quick and easy and solid to use....
customer_reviews.author: Wink

customer_reviews.title: Love the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Long time Benriner user after living in Japan. I finally decided to swap up from my older basic one after I started mashing my daikon instead of shreading it on my old bent tines. My wife thanks me since now with the notches I dont have to back it up against the wall (and make a mess there) in order to quickly do the necessary. Upgrades on the level control are also welcome. Great build quality and function as before. Can't recommend it enough, its going on my gift list for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beyreis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with one exception
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for years. The current model I am using has one flaw. The long side of the adjustable deck is able to flex too much. It does have a metal rod on the under side to prevent it from flexing but it needs to be stronger. I would make the metal rod larger.
customer_reviews.author: crippled1

customer_reviews.title: D
customer_reviews.text: The plastic teeth on the holder broke on its first use while cutting carrots. Terrible device.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I cut myself but I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these constantly to prepare vegetables for dishes. The blade is extremely sharp. I cut off a piece of my finger and it took weeks to heal. However, do not let that deter you. The new guard included in the new version is way better than the old one. It’s more pointy so it holds on to whatever you’re slicing very well. Without the guard, always do it slowly. It’s easy to clean as you can remove specific parts.
customer_reviews.author: Austin M.

customer_reviews.title: Super model has a wide, non-adjustable gap
customer_reviews.text: I got the super benriner. The gap between the blade and the guide face isn't adjustable; it stays at a fixed distance, unlike other models. This complicates fabricating thin slices, and reduces control and consistency. This was a lot of money to spend on a tool that takes up space in my drawer at work and I am *always* hesitant to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original.
customer_reviews.text: Not as sharp as the original. I almost returned it. Not super happy with it. I also do not like the huge knob on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Not for slicing Salami etc.
customer_reviews.text: Everything else works great, this is heavy duty plastic that feels sturdy, and looks minimalistic and incredible!
customer_reviews.author: Inna S.E.

customer_reviews.title: Sliced my finger/palm a couple of times
customer_reviews.text: You can very very easily slice your finger with this. Gotta be very careful and focused while using it.
customer_reviews.author: Fei

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I’ve bought in awhile
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, dependable and doesn’t rust. Excellent quality product that will withstand commercial use
customer_reviews.author: yekaterina balagian

customer_reviews.title: Everyone that cares about cooking should have one
customer_reviews.text: Absolute game changer in the kitchen and it’s huge! Everyone in my family wants one now.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Welsh

customer_reviews.title: It is good for small onions only
customer_reviews.text: This mandoline, cuts like a razor, but the only bad thing, is not good for big onions, only smalls ones
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The mandoline being used by virtually every professional chef you see on TV. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this great piece of culinary equipment. I've been wanting one to add to my collection of culinary products. I'm called i went with the commercial grade type so I know it will last me a life time.
customer_reviews.author: bdmbooks

customer_reviews.title: Why do you need this?
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, works great !!! I make beautiful Korean carrots !!! Blades from Japan,very sharp,easy to cut !!!
customer_reviews.author: Valery Mutoukin

customer_reviews.title: must be careful
customer_reviews.text: First thing, I cut my self, second thing, this is a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: goldie

customer_reviews.title: Slice, Slice, Baby...
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp, great size and easy to use. It’s a well made piece of equipment and is worth buying. Be careful this tool can do some damage; I recommend getting a safety glove.
customer_reviews.author: WineCommander

customer_reviews.title: Only shreds not slices
customer_reviews.text: I read the directions and was only interested in using the simple blade already attached. Regardless of the width, and how far I turned the dial the slicer only shredded my lemons and cucumbers. I don't feel this is a superior product- my old simple no name one worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The guard is pretty useless so just be very careful! Otherwise the tool is great. Recommend cut gloves for the young or inexperienced
customer_reviews.author: Gm

customer_reviews.title: Product looks good but missing blades
customer_reviews.text: Opened the package when delivered, there was one blade missing and one blade had damaged tooth. Unfortunately, I had to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Defective blade
customer_reviews.text: Only used on cabbage, carrots and potatoes probably less than 20 times and there are already small chips out of blade.
customer_reviews.author: ca

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent addition to any kitchen. Sharp blade, the attachments work exactly as you want them to, a breeze to clean. It would be nice if the adjustment dial indicated the width of the slice, but that’s what test slices are for.
customer_reviews.author: Roosco

customer_reviews.title: Slicing now a dream
customer_reviews.text: Great product, made well, very sharp blades (my thumb found this out! Use caution!) I sliced the ingredients for pickles in record time. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MayKay

customer_reviews.title: favorite kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite kitchen gadgets. It makes quick work of whatever I making and is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forget about cutting your finger tips
customer_reviews.text: The hold in surfaces thanks tip the rubber tip is a great addition.... This equipment just got a whole lot better.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen mainstay.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Chef tested for over 15 years.. just keep it clean and sharp. Make sure you practice and take your time when using this. Will easily remove anything you put on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: ChefTK

customer_reviews.title: usability
customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to be a primary product for use in a cook's kitchen. The instructions are in and Asian language. The pictures are so obscure I can't figure out how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: One of the best mandolin’s for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp blades, different sizes, easy to use, made from sturdy materials.
customer_reviews.author: Max Dixon

customer_reviews.title: New model
customer_reviews.text: This is a great upgrade to an already necessary kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Southern

customer_reviews.title: Got what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Bought to slice fruit to dry. Wanted pieces the same size so they were put in dryer and all dried the same.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Ahearn

customer_reviews.title: excellent mandoline
customer_reviews.text: Razer sharp, as advertised. Easy to clean and disassemble for cleaning. Decent grip on the handguard.
customer_reviews.author: Krishach

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Sturdy, Sharp blades and Made in Japan!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got the standard version. I would buy again. Highly recommended if you are looking for a real mandoline.
customer_reviews.author: BN

customer_reviews.title: Get one soon, you'll love it!
customer_reviews.text: My go to item for slicing so many items. Super fast, easy and SHARP!
customer_reviews.author: Nole mom

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The mandelin I received was missing fine julian blade .it came with only 2 blades
customer_reviews.author: marzieh latifzadeh

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: No fancy bells and whistles, just the basics that get the job done. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DotF

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for my "cheffy" husband. He absolutely loved it and used it every day!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best investment .
customer_reviews.text: The best and sharpest mandolin I have ever bought .
customer_reviews.author: Fatiha Boutara

customer_reviews.title: Sauerkraut Slicer
customer_reviews.text: The Benriner jumbo slicer is well made. The slicer will slice cabbage ultra thin for sauerkraut or slaw. Unfortunately, the blade can be hard to adjust. After turning the adjustment knob you must push the guide plate down to adjust the thickness. Turning the knob to decrease the thickness is difficult and the plate needs to be pushed from the backside. It took several tries to get the thickness I wanted. Once adjusted the Benriner is a joy to use. The Benriner has a notch that fit well over my large 11" diameter stainless bowl to hold it in place while slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great, but wish it would cut thicker slices (and measure the thickness)
customer_reviews.text: It really is a great mandoline in almost every way. Super easy to use and clean, super sharp, just great. My two complaints: 1. the max thickness seems to be about 1/8" or maybe a little more. it doesn't seem to make it all the way to 1/4" and certainly not beyond, which is a bummer as sometimes i need thicker slices. 2. there's no way to know for sure how thick it is. i've tried measuring, but it's really not that easy. i'd love for it to have some way of indicating the thickness of it's setting, that would be great. otherwise, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon0214

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, sharp, adequate size, good variety of blades, and easily comes apart for cleaning. Nylon holder for food being sliced protects fingers from the blade. Blade width easily adjusted but no markings or way to repeat an a previous setting without trial and error each time but over time. Only mandoline I have ever owned or used so value my opinion accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: not as stable and not thick enough
customer_reviews.text: We were hoping this mandoline would slice thicker (no actual details on thickness). While it did have an adjustment, the thickest setting meant that the base becomes unstable, and the adjustable part pops up after each slice. So it was a no go for our apple slicing. Perhaps its just really meant for thin slices. Apples though did not slice easily.
customer_reviews.author: G. Asturi

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I used this to try to grate (shred) carrots and potatoes. The food holder is a cheap piece of plastic with dull points on it. The points don't hold harder vegetables, so the vegetable just falls off. If you try to shred vegetables without the holder, you will shred your fingers. Since you have to take it apart to clean it properly, it really isn't any easier to clean than the food processor. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Raffles

customer_reviews.title: blades dull and vegetable holder inadequate
customer_reviews.text: Tried with both onion and potatoes. Interchangeable blade was in correct V-shaped orientation in front of the cross-sectioning blade but slicing was not easy because the blades are not sharp. Also the vegetable holder has short plastic tips that do not hold the vegetable securely. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S

customer_reviews.title: A must have kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: I love my mandolin slicer! I bought this one to replace one that my kids somehow managed to lose and the quality on this one is much better. It’s very sturdy and simple to use and clean. This makes preparing Korean food so much easier than trying to hand cut everything.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Wow love this tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and easy to use. I got this to make sweet potato chips in my freeze dryer. In addition, this device is great for preparing veggies for salads. I recommend this simple but versatile and effective kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.author: Electric Z

customer_reviews.title: DIFFICULT TO USE, VERY LITTLE INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April, didn't try it, now I am trying to use it, it is very difficult to use and to clean. If I knew that before, I would of send it back. The instructions given are not enough almost doesn't make any sense, maybe if you know Japanese. It was a waste of money for me. I will be searching for another one.
customer_reviews.author: candle1357

customer_reviews.title: I should have had one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.text: With this and an air fryer you can have homemade french fries within 15 minutes of the urge striking you. Easy to keep clean. Be careful, blade is sharp. Use the "pusher".
customer_reviews.author: UpRider

customer_reviews.title: Every penny
customer_reviews.text: Love this product used it as advertised shredded carrots and cabbage if your not comfortable with this but a glove and enjoy EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.author: DELON SOLOMON

customer_reviews.title: Easy and amazing.
customer_reviews.text: First use was amazing. Sliced tomatoes and zucchini for a casserole. Completed the task in no time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Margy

customer_reviews.title: this is a must have in a chefs kitchen
customer_reviews.text: really the only brand Benriner to own, its the best, have tried several brands, but stick with what the chefs use.
customer_reviews.author: jessica Kay

customer_reviews.title: Only one plate provided
customer_reviews.text: Wish it would come with more plates tor at least provide info on where to order different cutting plates
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: This is what professionals use and so can you.
customer_reviews.text: It what is was needing for years and now it was at to right price. My only complaint is I should’ve bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste money on OXO
customer_reviews.text: Better than ANY mandoline you'll find at BBB for 80 dollars. What I've always found in professional kitchens, so it should be good enough for you too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the higher cost
customer_reviews.text: Jumbo size does have adjustable slice thickness. Extra wide cutting surface works with Vidalia onions. Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JR

product_meta.title: Benriner Super Slicer, with 4 Japanese Stainless Steel Blades, Beige
product_meta.description: Style Name:Super Slicer, BeigeBenriner's Beige mandolin quickly and easily slices medium fruits and veggies into consistently sized pieces that cook evenly and look great, just like the pros. It's a favorite of kitchen tools for easier food preparation to save lots of time during food preparation. Create delicious, healthy entrees and side dishes, like stir fry's, casseroles, or Vegetarian recipes, and prepare healthy Snacks or garnish, salad toppings, and so much more. Safe and easy to use. The safety guard holds smaller end pieces securely for less waste and to protect fingers. With 4 interchangeable cutting blades and an easy-turn dial to adjust slice thickness, it's easy to make a variety of cuts to fit every recipe. Use the straight-edge blade to make wider slices for chips, scalloped potatoes or thinly sliced onion, The coarse-toothed blade for Chunky French fry cuts and carrot sticks, medium-toothed or fine-toothed blades to make long, narrow and extra-narrow strips, called julienne or matchstick cuts, for hashbrowns, shoestring potato nests, noodles (zucchini spaghetti strands) and stir fry's the nonskid rubber base adds stability during use or securely hook the groove onto bowls to collect slices. Simply snap in the desired blade, hold the mandolin slicer by the handle and slice directly into a bowl or onto a work surface. Made from Handcrafted Japanese stainless steel blades and BPA-free plastic, Includes 4 interchangeable blades (straight edge, coarse-tooth, medium-tooth and fine-tooth), large open comfortable handle and nonskid rubber base. The safety guard holds smaller end pieces for safe-and-easy slicing and protects fingers. Disassembles for easy cleaning. Top-rack dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
feature_bullets: Benriner's Beige mandolin slicer easily slices medium fruits and veggies into consistently sized pieces that cook evenly and look great
Made from handcrafted Japanese stainless steel blades and BPA-free plastic; Large open handle for Comfort and non-skid rubber base for added stability
4 interchangeable blades (straight edge, coarse, medium and fine tooth); make wide slices, chunky cuts, long narrow and extra-narrow julienne strips
Safety guard holds smaller pieces to protect fingers; hooks onto bowls to collect slices; easy-turn dial adjusts Thickness; disassembles for cleaning
Easy to use; saves time; Make chips, French fries, garnish, hash browns, stir fry, and more; Measures 14. 5 x 5. 25-Inches; top-rack dishwasher safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars608 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
